Sgurr a' Ghreadaidh

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgurr a' Ghreadaidh is the highest point on the central part of the Cuillin ridge. It has two summits, separated by the narrowest arete in the British Isles - sharp as a razor. The true top is the northerly one, usually reached via a hard scramble up An Dorus, though an alternative is given in our description.

 You have not climbed Sgurr a' Ghreadaidh.

Region: Isle of Skye

Altitude: 973 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.45/5
Rating: 4.4/5 (47 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Sgurr a Ghreadaidh and Sgurr a Mhadaidh via An Dorus

Other routes and challenges

The alternative, harder scrambling approach over Sgurr na Banachdich and Sgurr Thormaid is covered as the optional extension in the route description above.
